data.title: Famous People Who Died in 1896
data.meta_description: Famous deaths in 1896. Learn about 99 historical figures, notable people and celebrities who died in 1896 like Alfred Nobel, José Rizal and H. H. Holmes.
data.text:
Alfred Ely Beach, American inventor, dies at 69

Joseph Hubert Reinkens, German Old Catholic bishop (b. 1821)

Paul Verlaine, French lyric poet (Sagesse; Clair de lune; Hombres), dies at 51

Jan 8 William Rainey Marshall, Governor of Minnesota (b. 1825)

Francis Channing Barlow, American lawyer, Union general (US Civil War, meet with General John Brown Gordon at Gettysburg), dies from influenza complications at 62

Matthew B Brady, US photographer (Civil War), dies at about 72

Charles Floquet, French statesman and 44th Prime Minister of France, dies at 67

Graciano López Jaena, Filipino journalist (La Solidaridad), orator, social reformist, and national hero, dies of tuberculosis at 39

Jan 20 Henry von Battenberg, German son-in-law of Queen Victoria, dies at 37

Frans Baeckelmans, Flemish architect (Court of Justice), dies at 68

Jan 25 Frederic Leighton, British painter and sculptor, President of the Royal Academy (1878-96), dies a day after being made a baron (shortest-lived peerage) at 65

Joseph Barnby, English conductor and composer, dies at 57

Jane Wilde, Irish poet, nationalist and mother of Oscar Wilde, dies at 74

Henry David Leslie, English composer, dies at 73

Abraham van Stolk, Dutch art collector, dies at 82

Ambroise Thomas, French opera composer (Mignon), and music professor, dies at 84

Feb 12 Isaac Murphy, American jockey, 628 wins on 1,412 mounts (44.5%), dies at 35

Carl Martin Reinthaler, German composer, dies at 73

E. J. Nicholson [Eliza Jane], American publisher (New Orleans' "Daily Picayune"), dies at 47

Arsène Houssaye, French novelist and poet, dies at 80

Giuseppe Arimondi, Italian general who fought in the Italo-Ethiopian War, dies in the Battle of Adwa at 49

Mar 1 Vittorio Dabormida, Italian general who fought in the Italo-Ethiopian War, dies in the Battle of Adwa at 53

Isaac Shadd, American-Canadian newspaper publisher (The Provincial Freeman), and politician (Mississippi House of Representatives, 1871-76), dies at 66 or 67

Thomas Hughes, English politician and author (Tom Brown's School days), dies at 73

E Rundle Charles, writer, dies

Charilaos Trikoupis, Greek politician (Prime Minister of Greece for 7 times from 1875-1895), dies at 63

John Rogers Thomas, Welsh-American baritone and composer of popular, classical, and sacred music, dies at 66

Alexander Ritter, German composer, dies at 62

Arthur Boreman, American lawyer, judge, and politician (1st Governor of West Virginia, 1863-69; US Senator from West Virginia, 1869-75), dies at 72

Thomas Meik, Scottish civil engineer, dies at 84

Henry Parkes, Australian politician (longest non-consecutive Premier of the Colony of New South Wales), dies at 80

Heinrich von Treitschke, German historian and political writer, dies at 61

Antonio Cagnoni, Italian opera composer, dies at 68

Nasr-ed-Din, shah of Persia (184.-96), murdered at 65

Silas Adams, American lawyer and politician (b. 1839)

H. H. Holmes

American serial killer associated with 27 deaths, executed by hanging at 34

Juan Morel Campos, Puerto Rican composer (Danza), dies at 38

Nora Perry, American poet, journalist and children's writer, dies (b. 1831)

Sophus Tromholt, Norwegian astrophysicist and photographer (photographed Sami people), dies at 45 [1]

Clara Schumann

German pianist and composer of the Romantic era, dies of a stroke at 76

Jose Asunción Silva, Colombian poet (Nocturno III), dies at 30

Aleksandr Grigorievich Stoletov, Russian physicist, made advances in electrical engineering, dies at 56

May 27 Allard Pierson, Dutch theologist, philosopher and art historian, dies at 65

Gabriel Auguste Daubrée, French geologist, dies at 81

Gerhard Rohlfs, German explorer and ambassador in Abyssinia, dies at 65

Pavlos Carrer, Greek composer (Isabella d'Aspeno), dies at 67

Jun 7 Wyatt Eaton, Canadian-American artist, dies from tuberculosis at 47

Amelia Dyer, English murderer of 300 infants, hanged at Newgate Prison, London (b. 1829)

Friedrich Gottlieb Schwencke, German organist and composer, dies at 72

Emile A. H. Seipgens, Dutch novice priest, beer brewer, poet and writer (The Chaplain Bardelo), dies at 58

Jun 25 Lyman Trumbull, U.S. Senator from Illinois (1855-73), dies at 82

Prince Louis, French Duke of Nemours, dies at 81

Harriet Beecher Stowe

American author (Uncle Tom's Cabin), dies at 85

Alexander Sergeyevich Famintsin, Russian composer, dies at 54

Ernst Curtius, German archaeologist and historian (Olympia), dies at 81

August Kekule von Stradonitz, German chemist who discovered structure of benzene ring, dies at 66

Edmond-Louis-Antoine Huot de Goncourt, novelist, dies at 74

Jul 16 William Hamilton Gibson, illustrator/author/novelist, dies

Abraham H. Cannon, American Mormon apostle (b. 1859)

William Robert Grove, Welsh physicist and inventor of the first fuel cell, dies at 85

Otto Lilenthal, German aircraft pioneer, killed during a glider test at 48

Otto Lilienthal, German aircraft pioneer (explored winged flight through gliders), dies falling to his death from his glider at 48

Thomas Chamberlain, officer of the 20th Maine at the Battle of Gettysburg

John Everett Millais, English painter (Order of Release), dies at 67

Bridget Driscoll, 1st person in Great Britain to die in an auto-accident

Frederick Crouch, British-American cellist, composer ("Kathleen Mavourneen"), Confederate soldier, and music teacher, dies at 88

Aug 18 Richard Avenarius, German philosopher (founded the epistemological theory of knowledge known as empirical criticism), dies at 52

Josiah Dwight Whitney, American Geologist who led the California Geological Survey (Mount Whitney and Whitney Glacier are named for him), dies at 76

Alexei Lobanov-Rostovsky, Russian statesman (b. 1824)

Johannes Habert, composer, dies at 62

Nat Thomson, Australian cricket all-rounder (2 Tests, 1st batsman dismissed in first Test match 1877), dies at 57

Francis James Child, American ballad collector (b. 1825)

Antônio Carlos Gomes, Brazilian opera composer, first from outside of Europe have a successful career in Italy, dies at 60

Armand-Hippolyte-Louis Fizeau, French physicist, dies at 75

Gottfried Conradi, Norwegian composer, dies at 76

Gilbert Duprez, French composer, dies at 89

Sep 23 Ivar A Aasen, Norwegian linguistic/poet, dies at 83

Louis Gerhard De Geer, 1st Swedish Prime Minister (1876-80), dies at 78

Sep 24 Percy McDonnell, Australian cricket batsman (19 Tests, 3 x 100s; Victoria CA, NSW CA, Queensland CA), dies of cardiac failure at 35

William Morris, English artist, writer and socialist associated with Arts and Crafts movement who championed handmade production, dies at 62 [1]

Anton Bruckner

Austrian composer (Te Deum; Wagner Symphony), Wagner disciple and "monumental bore", dies at 72

Edward White Benson, Archbishop of Canterbury (b. 1829)

Christian Emil Krag-Juel-Vind-Frijs, Danish nobleman and politician (Council President of Denmark 1865-70), dies at 78

Félix Tisserand, French Astronomer, dies at 51

James Henry Greathead, British engineer (b. 1844)

Paul-Armand Challemel-Lacour, French statesman (b. 1827)

Spyridon Xyndas, Greek composer, dies at 84

Antonio Peña y Goñi, Spanish composer, dies at 50

George Washington Gale Ferris Jr., American engineer and inventor (Ferris Wheel), dies of typhoid fever at 37

Nov 22 Leon Leopold Lewandoski, Polish composer, dies at 65

Nov 22 Vicente Riva Palacio, Mexican Liberal politician, military leader and writer (Governor of the State of Mexico), dies at 64

Coventry Patmore, English poet and critic (The Angel in the House), dies at 73

Ernst Engel, German statistician and economist (Law of Engel), dies at 75

Alfred Nobel

Swedish chemist who invented dynamite and founded the Nobel Prize ceremony on this date, dies at 63

John GR Acquoy, Dutch theologian and church historian, dies at 67

Emil du Bois-Reymond, German physiologist, co-discoverer of nerve action potential and founder of modern electrophysiology, dies at 78

John Brown, British manufacturer (b. 1816)

José Rizal

Filipino nationalist and novelist ('Noli Me Tángere', 'El Filibusterismo'), executed by firing squad at 35

Leland Hone, Irish cricket wicketkeeper (1 Test; first Irishman to represent England; MCC), dies at 43
